Why <S%H2586>Hanun<s%> <S%H3947>took<s%> <S%H1732>David's<s%> <S%H5650>servants,<s%> and <S%H1548>shaved<s%> off the one <S%H2677>half<s%> of their <S%H2206>beards,<s%> and <S%H3772>cut<s%> off their <S%H4063>garments<s%> in the <S%H2677>middle,<s%> even to their <S%H8357>buttocks,<s%> and <S%H7971>sent<s%> them away.

And he <S%H559>said,<s%> <S%H518>If<s%> the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> be too <S%H2388>strong<s%> for me, then you shall <S%H3444>help<s%> me: but <S%H518>if<s%> the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> be too <S%H2388>strong<s%> for you, then I will <S%H1980>come<s%> and <S%H3467>help<s%> you.

And when the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> that the <S%H758>Syrians<s%> were <S%H5127>fled,<s%> then <S%H5127>fled<s%> they also <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H52>Abishai,<s%> and <S%H935>entered<s%> into the <S%H5892>city.<s%> So <S%H3097>Joab<s%> <S%H7725>returned<s%> from the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H5983>Ammon,<s%> and <S%H935>came<s%> to <S%H3389>Jerusalem.<s%>
